headline.main: That Sound Is a Healthier Teixeira, Delivering One Hit After Another

docs.snippet: Mark Teixeira, who has been feeling better since having a severe cough, hit two home runs to back a solid outing by pitcher C. C. Sabathia....
docs.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. -- There is an evolving mathematical ratio, in inverse proportion, that is helping the Yankees win baseball games lately. The less Mark Teixeira coughs, the more he hits. Teixeira had had a severe cough and blocked air passages since April 12 and it was so debilitating at times that he had trouble breathing. It limited his time in the weight room and the batting cage, and sapped him of his signature power.

headline.main: So, Your Idea Hit a Brick Wall. Congratulations!

docs.snippet: Kyle Zimmer of the nonprofit First Book says that when it comes to hiring, she looks for people who have tried great new things, failed and overcome the disappointment....
docs.abstract: Adam Bryant Corner Office features interview with First Book president, chief executive and co-founder Kyle Zimmer discussing her management technique. Photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: This interview with Kyle Zimmer, president, chief executive and co-founder of the nonprofit First Book, which provides books for children in need, was conducted, edited and condensed by Adam Bryant.

docs.snippet: ORTNER--Everett, age 92, passed away on May 22, 2012, following a brief illness. Everett was an active leader in local, national and international preservation activities and a recipient of the Lucy G. Moses Preservation Award for Lifetime Achieve...
docs.lead_paragraph: ORTNER--Everett, age 92, passed away on May 22, 2012, following a brief illness. Everett was an active leader in local, national and international preservation activities and a recipient of the Lucy G. Moses Preservation Award for Lifetime Achievement from the Landmarks Conservancy. He will be missed by family and friends, and by scores of Park Slope neighbors for whom he, along with his wife Evelyn, brought about the rebirth of a dying Brooklyn neighborhood to create one of the nation's most desirable urban communities in which to live and raise a family. We thank you. Everett is survived by a nephew, Arthur Levin of Delray Beach, FL, a niece Roberta Feigenbaum of Fairlawn OH and a godchild, Monica Musich of Fairport, NY. A private memorial service will be held at Green-Wood Cemetery on a date to be determined. Contributions honoring Everett can be sent to Preservation Volunteers, 1995 Broadway, Suite 605, New York, NY 10023. Preservation Volunteers is an on-going not-for-profit co-founded by Everett and Evelyn Ortner.

docs.snippet: India-centric reading, and the symbolism of trees....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dev Patel is a British actor of Indian descent who is best known for his leading role in the 2008 film ''Slumdog Millionaire.'' His latest film is ''The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel,'' which opened in theaters nationwide this week. READING One of my favorite books right now is called ''Animal's People,'' by Indra Sinha. It's about this awful event in India called the Bhopal gas tragedy. There's another book I am reading called ''The White Tiger,'' by Aravind Adiga, about a poor kid who becomes a driver to a rich actor. They are very India-centric and cool and gritty, funny books. Dark humor is the common theme between them.

headline.main: Retail: No Deal For Talbots as Buyout Bid Deadline Expires

docs.snippet: Talbots said Friday that the private equity firm Sycamore Partners had walked away from negotiations over a proposed $215 million buyout of the troubled women's clothing retailer.      Shares of Talbots tumbled more 30 percent in early trading, to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Talbots said Friday that the private equity firm Sycamore Partners had walked away from negotiations over a proposed $215 million buyout of the troubled women's clothing retailer. Shares of Talbots tumbled more 30 percent in early trading, to less than $1.80.

headline.main: U.S. Begins Three Weeks Full of Games by Watching Donovan Collect a Net Full of Goals

docs.snippet: Landon Donovan scored three goals in his first game for the United States since September....

keywords.value: UNITED STATES MEN'S NATIONAL SOCCER TEAM
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. -- A Landon Donovan hat trick was the highlight of a masterly performance by the United States national team as it cruised to a 5-1 win over Scotland on Saturday to extend its winning streak to four games with the start of World Cup qualifying fast approaching. Donovan, the American team's career leading scorer, has not been with the United States squad since September, and his performance helped provide the offensive spark it had been missing.

docs.snippet: President Obama will host former President George W. Bush and his wife, Laura, at the White House next week for the unveiling of their official portraits, bringing the two presidents together at a time when Mr. Obama has been castigating Mr. Bush'...
docs.abstract: Caucus column; Pres Obama will host former Pres George W Bush and his wife Laura at the White House for the unveiling of their official portraits; event brings the two presidents together at a time when Obama has been castigating Bush's record on the campaign trail. (M)/
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama will host former President George W. Bush and his wife, Laura, at the White House next week for the unveiling of their official portraits, bringing the two presidents together at a time when Mr. Obama has been castigating Mr. Bush's record on the campaign trail. The ceremony on Thursday follows a longstanding tradition of welcoming back former presidents and first ladies for the hanging of their portraits, but the timing is particularly delicate as Mr. Obama uses Mr. Bush as a foil on the campaign trail against former Gov. Mitt Romney of Massachusetts.

headline.main: Dufner Leads by One at Colonial

docs.snippet: Jason Dufner matched Zach Johnson’s birdie putt on the 17th hole to finish with a four-under-par 66 for a one-stroke lead in the Colonial in Fort Worth....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jason Dufner matched Zach Johnson's birdie putt on the 17th hole to finish with a four-under-par 66 for a one-stroke lead in the Colonial in Fort Worth. Johnson was in second place after a 65. Roger Chapman shot a 64 to take a five-stroke lead into the final round of the Senior P.G.A. Championship in Benton Harbor, Mich.
